input.description: adapter name [Optional] The name of the adapter which is enabled on the Peer. The default adapter name is SCOMActor

This wrapper returns the available events associated with specified monitoring object.
Sample Item XML:
<items> <item> <timeout-secs>120</timeout-secs> <command-parameters> <instance> <filters> <filter> <management-object-prop-key>DisplayName</management-object-prop-key> <management-object-prop-val>Management Configuration Service</management-object-prop-val> <operand>equals</operand> </filter> </filters> </instance> </command-parameters> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
timeout-secs[Optional] Time in seconds after which the request will time-out of not completed. Default is: 60 secs
command-parameters[Required] This is the parent tag that contains actual parameters required to execute this particular operation.
instance [Required] This is the parent element for specifying the Management Object instance for which the events need to be searched.
filters[Required] This is the parent tag that contains all the filter criteria.
The following tags are required if 'filters' tag is provided by user filter[Required] This tag contains a particular filter criteria. More than one filter tags can be provided. All the filter criteria will be ANDED to get the final result.
management-object-prop-key[Required] This tag contains the name of the property of the Management Object entity by which we want to filter the search.
management-object-prop-val[Required] This tag contains the value of the property specified in management-object-prop-val. Please refer to 'Regular Expressions Guide.doc' for more details. Texts like true or false should be enclosed in single quotes if they are to be treated as String rather than as Boolean entities.
operand[Optional] This tag specifies the operation that will be applied between 'discovery-prop-key' and 'discovery-prop-val'.Please refer to 'Filter Operators Guide.doc' for more details. Valid values - equals, not equals, matches
